1.text: Use alcohol and alcohol-based products to peel away polish.

2.text: Use white vinegar, or a vinegar solution mixed with lemon juice, to fight nail polish.

3.text: Use some basic toothpaste to scrub away polish.
3.vid: /8/84/Remove Nail Polish Without Using Remover Step 3 Version 6.360p.mp4

4.text: Mix two parts hydrogen peroxide with one part hot water and soak for 10 minutes.
4.vid: /3/39/Remove Nail Polish Without Using Remover Step 4 Version 5.360p.mp4

5.text: Use a powerful solvent or paint remover alternatively, though it is not recommended.

6.text: Apply your chosen product with a cotton ball.
6.vid: /2/20/Remove Nail Polish Without Using Remover Step 6 Version 8.360p.mp4

7.text: Let the product sit for a minute.

8.text: Wipe the product off your nails, scrubbing to remove polish.
8.vid: /e/e3/Remove Nail Polish Without Using Remover Step 8 Version 8.360p.mp4

9.text: Soak your hand in hot water, rubbing and chipping at the polish, and try again.
9.vid: /e/e9/Remove Nail Polish Without Using Remover Step 9 Version 8.360p.mp4

10.text: Select another nail polish that will not dry too quickly.

11.text: Apply the polish to one nail at a time.
11.vid: /7/73/Remove Nail Polish Without Using Remover Step 11 Version 8.360p.mp4

12.text: Wipe the new polish off quickly.
12.vid: /2/23/Remove Nail Polish Without Using Remover Step 12 Version 8.360p.mp4

13.text: Repeat painting and wiping until your nails are free of polish.
13.vid: /0/04/Remove Nail Polish Without Using Remover Step 13 Version 8.360p.mp4

14.text: Make a base coat with glue and water.

15.text: Apply and dry the glue base coat before putting on polish.
15.vid: /3/3d/Remove Nail Polish Without Using Remover Step 15 Version 5.360p.mp4

16.vid: /2/24/Remove Nail Polish Without Using Remover Step 16 Version 5.360p.mp4

17.text: Soak your nails when you're ready to remove your polish.

18.text: Peel off your old nail polish.
18.vid: /4/47/Remove Nail Polish Without Using Remover Step 18 Version 7.360p.mp4
